turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Sultanate of Mogadishu.
turn.1: What was the religion of the Mogadishu Sultanate?
turn.2: Most were Muslims, although a few adhered to heathen bedouin tradition; there were also a number of Abyssinian Christians further inland.
turn.3: What can you tell me about the city-state of Mogadishu?
turn.4: Mogadishu itself was a wealthy, powerful and well-built city-state, which maintained commercial trade with kingdoms across the world.
turn.5: What kind of defenses did Mogadishu have?
turn.6: The metropolis city was surrounded by walled stone fortifications.
turn.7: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.8: Somali merchants from Mogadishu established a colony in Mozambique to extract gold from the mines in Sofala.
turn.9: What kind of trade was done with other Mediterranean city-states?
turn.10: During the 9th century, Mogadishu minted its own Mogadishu currency for its medieval trading empire in the Indian Ocean.
turn.11: What was the most important city-state of Mogadishu?
turn.12: It centralized its commercial hegemony by minting coins to facilitate regional trade.
